rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. You's Chem 421 course is very difficult as an undergrad. You can take it before 420, but I would only suggest doing so if you're extremely comfortable with your proficiency in organic chemistry. On the plus side it makes Chem 420 seem more like a review.

He's funny and a good teacher if you go to his office hours, read the book, and do the homework, etc... It's difficult to do well in any class if you don't prepare well, especially orgo2. This is the same, sometimes he's difficult to understand in lecture because English isn't his first language, but one-on-one he's much more clear for some reason.
